intro: Hedyotis thymifolia, commonly known as the thyme-leaved bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and narrow, aromatic leaves that resemble those of thyme. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Hedyotis thymifolia is often found in temperate regions and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
